content:
Sembra tutto corretto. Prova a impostare la voce "soddisfa anche solo una condizione" e vedi se così funziona (fallo magari per uno solo dei filtri).

Se hai installato delle estensioni, prova a verificare se in Modalità risoluzione dei problemi i filtri funzionano -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/modalita-risoluzione-problemi-thunderbird (se necessario puoi avviare Thunderbird in Modalità risoluzione dei problemi anche per qualche giorno)

Inoltre, utilizzi programmi per l'ottimizzazione / pulizia del sistema?

content:
For Thunderbird which is a third party program to get access to the server you need to have selected the option to allow it.

  • Sign in to Xfinity Email using your Xfinity ID and password.
  • In the top-right corner, click the Gear icon, then select Settings.
  • Click Security.
  • Select the checkbox under Third Party Access Security

Please confirm that 'Third Party Access' checkbox is selected.

jeraldasmith said
This came from a document that said Support, Moz://a at the top of the page. The menu was Switch from Pop to IMAP account. I then selected Disable your account and create the IMAP account on page 3. I never was able to disable my POP account. I already had tried tried to creating settings for my email account. I was not able to do that but got a message my IMAP account already existed. I then edited the SMTP settings and set them to settings given to me by fhowers. That worked but I was not able to send ermail. That is when I stared to look for something to enter my credentials for my email account on imap.comcast.net.

I think you are talking about a response from sfhowes which is in one of your other questions on identical topic. You should have responded to that message from him if you had a query. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1443352#answer-1644911

At this point in time - I have no idea what you have done.

First you say you have a Pop account. Then you mention you tried to created a new account - File > New > Existing mail account as an Imap account which failed. So I'm not sure at this point whether you are still using the original Pop account or not. Then you mention editing the smtp.

Perhaps it would be a good idea to post some information on current set up. In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' section
  • Post an image showing all data in that section OR copy all the text in that area and post it into this question.

Provide info:

  • In 'Account Settings'
  • Select 'Server Settings' for the account
  • Top right it will say 'Server Type' - what does it say 'Pop' or 'Imap' ?


Do not create any more questions on this topic because it means continuity of conversation is lost. Always post responses in this question.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Hello there We have read the message We try to help


What passwords have you entered in your software program?

If you have entered a main password, see if you can disable it. Can you choose to remember password? Check whether you can check this box or not. And whether there will be an improvement? You can also manually create a new account and change your name.. This way you can check whether these wrong actions will occur again on the next account.

If you have less time and want to solve these issues immediately, a hot installation may be best for you, which will indeed solve these common problems for you more quickly. It occurs more often with another type of email software that is also recent. But with Thunderbird it is not an unusual topic either.


Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird

content: A possible approach: - highlight the folder, right-click, select properties, and then click 'repair'
creator: davidsk

content: Good morning! Thanks, David, for your reply - Very helpful information that I didn't know existed - but it did not fix the emails' contents. Some contents look like code-some just blank- attachments show up on completely unrelated emails. Lesson learned! I need to go back to the stable version. Thanks again! Btw- Any other ideas to restore the email contents are greatly appreciated.
creator: sherri9

content: You're welcome. To revert to the release level, here are basics: - uninstall the beta. there will be a prompt to save or keep data. Click the option to KEEP. - install the release level. It should immediately recognize all your data. If you receive a message of profile incompatibility, exit thunderbird, click windows file explorer, and delete the compatibility.ini file and then restart thunderbird. HOWEVER, I always recommend doing a backup prior to doing anything major. Further, I encourage regular backups (always do backups when thunderbird is not running to be safe).
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you so much! Your clear instructions got me back up and running in the release level. Also - just a note for others that might experience this: Once I reverted back to the release level, and then used your previous instruction to RC folder and repair - All of my emails returned to normal contents!!!!!!! Thanks for all you do! So appreciate it.
creator: sherri9

content: You are most welcome. Thanks for the kind words. :)
creator: davidsk
